meta.title: Epoch Time Converter - Free Online Unix Tool
meta.description: Convert Unix Epoch timestamps to human-readable dates and vice versa. Support for local time, GMT/UTC, and relative time with our free, instant converter.
meta.subtitle: Convert Unix timestamps to human-readable dates and vice versa

content.hero_description: Unix time (or Epoch time) is the system checking the heartbeat of the digital world. It tracks the number of seconds that have elapsed since the "Unix Epoch" — 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970.
content.efficiency_desc: Computers prefer simple integers over complex date strings. It's faster to process and store.
content.universal_desc: It ignores timezones during storage. 1696516200 is the same moment in Tokyo as it is in New York.
content.math_desc: Calculating the difference between two dates is as simple as simple subtraction (A - B).
content.code_title: Get Current Epoch in Your Language
content.apocalypse_desc: On January 19, 2038, 32-bit systems will run out of numbers to store the time, causing the "Unix Y2K". Most modern 64-bit systems are already safe for the next 292 billion years.

faq.a1: Unix timestamp (also known as epoch time or POSIX time) is the number of seconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC. It's a widely used standard for representing time in computer systems and programming.
faq.q2: Why use epoch time instead of regular dates?
faq.a2: Epoch time is timezone-independent, making it perfect for storing dates in databases and APIs. It's a simple integer that's easy to compare, sort, and calculate time differences. Most programming languages have built-in functions to convert between epoch time and human-readable dates.

meta.title: Time Unit Converter Online - Free Seconds to Hours
meta.description: Convert time durations instantly. Seconds to minutes, hours to days, weeks to months, and years.
meta.subtitle: Convert seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks & years

content.feature1_desc: Convert between seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks, months, and years.
content.feature2_desc: Perfect for scheduling, video editing, project timelines, and time tracking.
content.feature3_desc: Accurate time conversions for science, programming, and daily planning.
content.description_p1: Time is measured in various units depending on the scale: seconds for short durations, minutes and hours for daily activities, days for short periods, and weeks, months, and years for longer spans. The SI base unit is the second, defined by atomic clock precision. Understanding time conversions is essential for scheduling, programming, project management, and scientific calculations.
content.description_p2: One minute equals 60 seconds, one hour equals 3,600 seconds, and one day equals 86,400 seconds. There are 168 hours in a week and approximately 730 hours in a month. These conversions become crucial when working with different time scales, converting between formats, or calculating durations across various contexts.
content.usage_1: Project Management: Converting work hours to days or weeks
content.usage_3: Programming: Millisecond to second conversions for timers
content.usage_6: Travel: Calculating trip durations across time zones
content.faq_q1: How many seconds are in a day?
content.faq_a1: There are exactly 86,400 seconds in one day (24 hours × 60 minutes × 60 seconds = 86,400 seconds).
content.faq_q2: How do I convert hours to days?
content.faq_a2: Divide the number of hours by 24. For example, 48 hours ÷ 24 = 2 days. Our converter handles this automatically!
content.faq_a3: Earth's orbit takes approximately 365.25 days, which is why we have leap years every 4 years to add the extra quarter day and keep calendars aligned with seasons.
content.faq_q4: What's the difference between duration and time?
content.faq_a4: Time refers to a specific moment (e.g., 3:00 PM), while duration measures how long something lasts (e.g., 2 hours). This converter handles duration conversions.

meta.title: Time Zone Converter - Free Online World Clock
meta.description: Visualize time differences across the globe. Compare times between two cities or zones side-by-side. Ideal for arranging international meetings.
meta.subtitle: Convert time between different timezones worldwide accurately

content.hero_desc: Schedule meetings, catch flights, and coordinate across continents without the headache. Our converter handles all the math.
content.business_desc: Avoid the embarrassment of calling a client at 3 AM.
content.travel_desc: Know exactly when your flight lands in local time.
content.events_desc: Don't miss the start of a global livestream.
content.tip1_desc: Daylight Saving Time rules vary by country and change dates every year. Automatic converters are safer than mental math.
content.tip2_desc: It removes ambiguity between AM and PM (e.g., is 12:00 midnight or noon?).
content.tip3_desc: When calling across the Pacific (e.g., US to Australia), it is often already tomorrow on the other side.
content.faq_q1: Are GMT and UTC the same?
content.faq_a1: For most practical purposes, yes. UTC is the precise atomic standard, while GMT is the older solar-based standard. They are within a fraction of a second of each other.
content.faq_q2: Why do some zones have 30 or 45 minute offsets?
content.faq_a2: Political and geographical reasons. India (UTC+5:30) and Nepal (UTC+5:45) chose these offsets to better align solar noon with their longitude.
